programmes.show_description: Paramedics treat a woman who's in severe pain a week after giving birth and a woman with a bad cough. And a mum calls 999 when she struggles to wake her ill toddler.
Brand new series: When they find Marco's computer, Jess has all the evidence she needs to confront the blackmailer. But can she do so without losing everything?
Sir Robert, who's 93, is rushed to St George's with a low heart rate. Brad, who's crushed his finger at work, talks about what masculinity means to him and male role models.
A selection of favourite investigations. Jimmy Doherty visits Europe's biggest brewery. Kate Quilton challenges Matt Tebbutt to make crumpets. Plus: why is maple syrup so pricey?
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
Mandi and Paul pride themselves on their high standards at Oaklea Barns Guest House on Merseyside. But Ian is puzzled by plastic-covered lampshades. And Mark and Natalie have a loose loo.
Dave and Sanchia host the second visit, at The Guest House Worsthorne in Lancashire. Their guests are charmed by the 300-year-old cottage, but there are cleanliness concerns.
At Sleeperdorm Backpacker Hotel in Newcastle, Ian hopes his guests will leave their designer gear at the door and bunk up in his cheap and cheerful dorms. But things turn sour over dinner.
The final visit is to The Parsonage Hotel and Spa in York, where Mark and Natalie hope to impress their guests with their country manor, complete with pub, spa and restaurant.
It's the final day of the competition and the B&Bers meet for the last time to find out how much they've been paid. After some tit-for-tat feedback, the winner is announced.
Joe and Kirsty want to swap their Hampshire house for a forever home in the warmer climes of inland Valencia in Spain. Can Jean Johansson deliver their dream place for £280,000?
For years, Gareth and Hannah have been trying to no avail to buy a holiday home with the perfect sea views in Salobreña on Spain's Costa Tropical. Can Leah Charles-King improve their luck?
With help from his old friend Angus, Ian is looking for a holiday home on Ibiza for himself, his wife and their two sons. Can Ben Hillman find the one for £400k?
Devon. The first host, glamorous 51-year-old community nurse Tina, plans a menu that incorporates all of her favourite dishes, including a seaside-inspired starter and a Thai main. (Ep1/5)
Devon. Rob serves an Italian menu and gets his guests to draw each other in a no-holds-barred sketching session. What could possibly go wrong? (Ep2/5)
Devon. Pilot Rhys hopes to take the competition to new heights. But he's mistaken for a stripper, and Holly gets the hump when she's thrown out of an imaginary lifeboat. (Ep3/5)
Devon. HR manager Holly plans a menu inspired by her restaurant favourites. But her loo rules shock her guests - as does the revealing portrait that the boys find in her lounge... (Ep4/5)
Devon. Detective Steve is counting on a menu of bold flavours to win him the grand, on an evening full of fun, friction, feuding and experimental food. (Ep5/5)
In the Scottish Highlands, things get off on the wrong foot at Stephen and Margaret's B&B thanks to an unpopular shoes-off policy.
Graham hosts the week's second visit at his glampsite near Inverness, where he hopes to inspire a spirit of adventure with a search for the Loch Ness Monster.
In Perthshire, the B&Bers stay at Cultybraggan Camp, a site used as a prisoner of war camp in World War II. They've done it up since then, of course...
During the week's final visit, to James and Neil's hotel near Glasgow, the B&Bers try their hands at curling. But some relationships seem to be on thin ice.
It's been a topsy-turvy week with some B&Bers delighted with their scores - and others not so much. After a little bit of a praise and a lot of moaning, who'll win?
This episode explores luck and chance, when a young man is involved in a high-speed car crash, an 18-year-old breaks his leg playing football, and a great grandmother falls down the stairs.
Stroke specialist Bryan's having a tough day as two patients arrive at St George's displaying severe symptoms. And is Ronnie's back pain kidney stones or something more serious?
Fifty-year-old Sara is rushed to A&E after collapsing at work with a thunderclap headache. And Flynn was hit by a car while riding his bike and has hurt his leg.
Lynn is rushed to A&E after collapsing from a brain aneurysm. James is treated for a severely dislocated shoulder. And 30-year-old Lucas has a suspected urinary tract infection.
Paramedics treat an aggressive man who may have had a stroke, a boy who's struggling to breathe and a driver who's crashed their car while swerving to avoid a cow.
Fifty-year-old Sara is rushed to A&E after collapsing at work with a thunderclap headache. And Flynn was hit by a car while riding his bike and has hurt his leg.
Lynn is rushed to A&E after collapsing from a brain aneurysm. James is treated for a severely dislocated shoulder. And 30-year-old Lucas has a suspected urinary tract infection.
Some favourite investigations. Jimmy Doherty visits Spain to ask how much orange is in orange squash, Matt Tebbutt runs across a pond of custard and Kate Quilton lifts the lid on Marmite.
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
Discover the very latest must-haves for your home and garden with Must Have Ideas
Swansea area. DJ Kevin hosts a Spanish-themed night of laughter, singing and flirting, inspired by his favourite holiday destination: Benidorm. (Ep1/5)
Swansea area. Café bar owner Tino serves up an African banquet inspired by her homeland, and teaches her guests to twerk. But former bodybuilder Rob doesn't enjoy the experience... (Ep2/5)
Swansea area. Natalie has made some daft comments on the first two nights, and now her guests have low expectations. But will her George Michael-themed evening go with a Wham!? (Ep3/5)
Swansea area. Bodybuilder Rob serves up a simple Thai menu. But his main is very similar to his starter, and his dessert takes 'simple' to another level. (Ep4/5)
Swansea area. The final host, GP Janine, hopes to serve an ace tennis-themed evening. The guests turn up dressed for Centre Court, with Rob in a miniskirt. And Kevin gets emotional. (Ep5/5)
Andy and his partner Jacqui from Yorkshire have decided the time is right to follow their dream and buy a second home in Barbados. Danni Menzies shows them what their £400k can buy.
Jane is looking for a holiday home with a sea view on the Portuguese island of Madeira. Can property expert Ben Hillman find Jane's perfect place for her budget of £200,000?
Danni Menzies heads to the pretty medieval town of Treignac in France's Correze region, to help Alan and Joe find the perfect holiday home for their budget of £60,000.
Mark and Loretta look for their dream holiday home near Estepona on Spain's Costa del Sol, for their budget of £200,000. Can Craig Rowe find their perfect place?
House-hunters Amanda and Keith from Wiltshire are searching for a holiday home in the hillside villages of western Cyprus. With £250,000, Leah Charles-King shows them five great options.

programmes.show_name: Kirstie and Phil's Love It or...
programmes.show_description: ...List It: In Harrogate, Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet the Pogson family, who need a functional multigenerational space for their children and a grandparent.
In Edinburgh, Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help a couple who don't know what they want, and an American family with their hearts set on one of the priciest parts of town.
The B&Bers head down to Margate for the week's first visit, where hosts Tracy and Colin hope their guests will go wild for their animal-themed rooms.
Noorani's declaration that she'd happily eat off the bathroom floors at her B&B in Dorchester doesn't ring true for some of her guests.
Nancy and her friend Henrietta host at Nancy's family farmhouse in Wiltshire, where a cooking experience goes down well, but plumbing problems do not.
The final visit takes the B&Bers to Devon, where hosts Amanda and Josie aim to sweeten their guests with a visit to a local honey manufacturer.
After a week of dog poo diatribe, spicy omelettes and farm faux pas, the B&Bers meet one last time to have a big old row and find out who's won.
Brand new series: Paramedics treat a motorcyclist who's landed headfirst after colliding with a car and an 11-year-old girl who's drowsy and feeling sick following a seizure.
Mery, who's 17 weeks pregnant, is rushed to A&E after falling down her stairs. Jessica has a netball injury. And a junior doctor carries out a chest procedure for the first time.
A 79-year-old has chest injuries after a garden fall. A London Underground worker has had a suspected heart attack. And ex-sailor Peter has an infected splinter in his arm.
